cheatsheet.title: Generating an EMF Model from Rose

intro.description: This cheat sheet is a step-by-step description of generating an EMF model and model editor from Rose file.

cheatsheet.onCompletion: Congratulations you have succesfully created an EMF model from a UML specification described in Rose, generated the code, and created instances of the model.

item.title: Set Up the Environment
item.description: Your environment must be set up so you can perform the steps of this cheat sheet.

subitem.label: Download "library.mdl" to the directory of your workspace.
Delete or rename the following projects if they exist in your workspace:"library.rose","library.rose.edit","library.rose.editor"

item.title: Import the Model from Rose
item.description: First, you must create a new "library" EMF project in your workspace, where the model to be generated is defined in a Rose file.

subitem.label: Select "File->New->Project...". Expand "Eclipse Modeling Framework" and select "EMF Project". Then, click "Next".
Click "Browse File System...", locate the workspace directory and select the downloaded Rose model file "library.mdl".

item.title: Generate the EMF Model and Editor Code
item.description: Before the code can be ran by Eclipse the EMF Model and Editor Code must be generated and compiled.

subitem.label: In the generator, right click on "Library" and select "Generate ${this} Code".
If project is not build automatically, then select "Project->Build All" to compile the generated code.

item.title: Run the Generated Editor
item.description: Now, you are set to run the generated editor to created new library models.

subitem.label: Select "Run->Run As->Eclipse Application" to run a new instance of Eclipse with the newly generated editor.
Expand "Example EMF Model Creation Wizards" and select "Library Model". Then, click "Next".
Select "Library" as model object, then click "Finish".
In "Resource Set", expand "platform:/resource/librarytest/My.library". Right click "Library" and select "New Child->Writer" to create a Writer object in Library model.
